name: Change Channel using Find Channels modal
precondition: Run these tests on https://rc.test.mattermost.com/

customFields.Cypress Reports: STABLE - TM4J-Key-Mapped-In-Cypress-Stable - TM4J key found Cypress master-prod run report (SDET/QA)

inline.description:
1. Open the Find Channels modal by clicking on the "Find Channel" link on the sidebar or using ctrl/cmd+K keyboard shortcutÂ 
  2. Type the first few letters of a channel you want to switch to
  3. Locate the channel using up/down arrows+enter
inline.expectedResult:
After #2,
  • List of channels autocompletes as you type
  • Both, channel name and URL, are used when filtering out all valid results
After #3,
  • Using the up & down arrow keys navigates through the list
  • You should be redirected to the channel you selected

customFields.Related ticket(s): (Story) Webapp: Improve empty state for channel switcher search results â€” MM-23694

inline.description: • Repeat step 1 and use scroll and a mouse click to select a channel from the list
inline.expectedResult:
• Using the scroll navigates through the list
  • You should be redirected to the channel you selected

customFields.Related ticket(s): Channel Switcher - selecting a user, flashes the id instead of the name â€” MM-28297

inline.description:
• Type a search term that you know will return no results
e.g. a string of `w`
inline.expectedResult:
• Verify modal has a new empty search state
  • Blue search icon is shown regardless of the selected theme of the app
  • "No results for [search term]" text should wrap when using a long search termÂ

customFields.Related ticket(s): (Invalid) Old no results modal still displays on rc.test.mattermost.com â€” MM-25795

inline.description: Verify clicking on ESC or clicking outside of the modal closes the modal
inline.expectedResult:
• Modal closesÂ 
  • You should remain on the same channel you were previously viewingÂ
